data.fullContent: Children begin school at age five or six when they enter kindergarten. Kindergarten in the United States is one year long and children typically attend half-days or every other day. Teachers are usually women and are with one class all or most of the day. Teachers' assistants and classroom volunteers, usually parents, often help out with routine tasks in the classroom.
data.answer: 孩子们在五、六岁进入幼儿园时开始上学。美国的幼儿园为期一年，孩子们通常上半天班或每隔一天上一次。老师通常是女性，一天中的大部分时间都在上一个班。教师助理和教室志愿者，通常是家长，经常帮助完成教室里的日常工作。
